result.execSummary:
The defendant Glen C. Schiefelbein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Election Fraud-Illegal Voting, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 12.13(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant is not to vote in any election during any term of supervision.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Glen C. Schiefelbein

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned)-tpg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:24 am case called. Defendant Glen C. Schiefelbein in court with Russell Wilson-assisting with communication.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions friend that is assisting with communication. DA Blader states agreement reached. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Information filed by the State. Defendant has received information and waives further reading. Defendant wishes to enter a plea of Guilty.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Guilty. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months, concurrent to any other sentence. CONDITIONS: Not to Vote in any election, during any term of supervision. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2014 at 11:15 am.
Status conference on June 17, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant is prohibited from voting in any elections.    Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 1:15 PM: Defendant Glen C. Schiefelbein in court.  Scott C Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def is not able to communicate verbally for medical reasons.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Affirmative nods as to questioning of the Court.  Defendant referred to SPD for eligibility, receives SSD benefits.  Off Record for Def to speak with SPD directly on eligibility.  Case Recalled @ 2:40 PM:  Per SPD:  Def is not eligible for SPD services. Def wishes to speak with DA on his own.   Def nods affirmatively on speaking with the DA without counsel.   PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
